comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
CWGC has this:

BURTON, CLAUDE FITZGERALD

Rank: Lance Sergeant
Service No: 1916
Date of Death: 18/07/1916
Age: 21
Regiment/Service: South African Infantry "D" Coy. 1st Regt.
Panel Reference Pier and Face 4 C.
Memorial THIEPVAL MEMORIAL

Additional Information:
Son of the late Capt. George W. Burton, of Madras, Southern India, and of Naomi Elizabeth Burton (now Mrs. O'Connor), of "Calpe", Blackrock, Dublin. Educated at Sea Point School, Cape Town. On staff of National Bank of South Africa, Ltd. Also served in German South West Africa with Cape Peninsula Rifles and in Egypt.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
UK Commonwealth War Graves database gives his full name as Claude Fitzgerald Sommerville Burton.

Armorial Families of England shows that his grandfather was Henry Burton, Gentleman, b. 1817 ; d. 1894 who married Catherine Barnes {d. 1890), d. of Col. W. Somerville Mitchell, I.S.C.

His father was George William Burton, Gentleman, b. 1856 ; m. 1894, Naomi, eld. d. of Richard Ward, of Howden, Yorkshire. 2 younger brothers: Cyril Leeds McHutcheon Burton, Gentleman, b. 1897 and Alfred Vere Ansted Burton, Gentleman, b. 1900. Res. —
